intro: Myosotis staminea, commonly known as the pink scurfpox, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it has a fibrous root system. Myosotis staminea is often found in association with other native flora in its natural habitat.
